title: How long does it take to write a New York Times article? - Quora

response.answer_text: It will depend entirely upon the topic of the article.  Some factual and informative articles can take a day to research and write.  Investigative pieces by senior staff may be ongoing projects with occasional updates moving toward a finale as yet to be determined. A introductory journalism course may be of help if you are seriously interested in submitting articles cold.  In today's market where true investigation is going the way of button shoes, and plagiarism of good, deep journalism is becoming the norm, you may find it difficult to get paid for your work, but it will probably still be accepted and printed.

Most newspapers expect a certain amount of column inches per day. The average is 30 column inches in many cases so if you have a long story you might have several days researching and writing it while doing short stories, too. Editors want to get their money’s worth out of you for sure.
